devSecOps: Operations and security stakeholders are actively engaged throughout the development lifecycle. *
deliveringValue: Decision making for IT product and projects is based on what will carry the most value for the business
technicalDebt: We deploy working code to a production-like environment. *
methodology: We have a well-defined methodology for releasing new features to market which involves all areas of the business. *
cadence: We deploy working code to a production-like environment: *
rework: We rarely have to rework deployed code to fix bugs and issues. *
pipeline: Developers can deploy to a production-like environment using a fully automated pipeline. *
sideEffects: We can confidently make changes to our entire codebase, without the risk of unexpected side-effects. *
transparency: We are an open, transparent organisation which shares all information internally. *
learning: We have a well-established culture of learning and the company invests in educating its employees. *
learnFromFailure: We are open and honest about our failings and treat them as an opportunity to learn, without assigning blame. *
careerPath: We have a well-defined career path and employees are given the support and guidance they need to grow within the organisation. *
diversity: We are a diverse team with people from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences. *
autonomy: Teams have autonomy to decide on the tools, technologies, practices and methodologies they use to complete their tasks. *
wholeTeam: The team have immediate access to all the people and knowledge they require to complete their work. *
knowledgeSharing: Knowledge is shared at all levels throughout the team and each member can perform any required task. *
tdd: We value Test-driven Development (TDD) and never write production code without first writing a test. *
architecture: Change is localised and tested with minimal impact on other parts of the application. *
cleanCode: Our code is easy to understand and maintain. *
peerReview: All production code is peer-reviewed comprehensively before it is considered “done”. *
welcomeFirstParagraph: How effective is your organisation's software delivery?
welcomeSecondParagraph: Take our quick 20 question quiz to measure your organisation's current level of software maturity across five areas:
welcomeThirdParagraph: And we'll send you a personalised report, including actionable steps for how to improve your organisation.
